newsitem.title: USA: Steel of W. Va. sees no improvement soon.
newsitem.headline: Steel of W. Va. sees no improvement soon.

text.p: Steel of West Virginia Inc said on Tuesday that its third quarter earnings were hurt by a downturn in certain industries the company serves, as well as reduced sales, higher maintenance costs and a higher tax rate.

"The market demand for our products has softened and continues to be flat," company President and Chief Executive Robert Bunting said in a statement. "We do not see any significant improvement in the near term."
The company said a downturn in the truck trailer industry was a drag on its results.
Costs for natural gas and depreciation expenses also increased, contributing to the quarter's lackluster results.

For the quarter, the company posted net income of $9,000, or $0.00 per share, on net sales of $22.23 million. In the same period the prior year, the company reported net income of $2.45 million, or $0.37 per share, on net sales of $32.55 million.
